page.title: 07Sheep farming in Inversnaid
page.content: In November you put the tup out to the hill so they can mate the ewes. In January you bring the tups off the hill. In the Spring we have dosing and dipping. We dose the{sheep}to get rid of worms. We dip the sheep to prevent scab. At the beginning of Summer we clip hoggs and eild ewes. The hoggs are hard to clip because it is the first time they are clipped. In the middle of summer we do milk clipping i.e. clipping the ewes that have lambs. It is very arduous because you have to work long hours. At the end of summer or beginning of autumn we do speaning ie.taking the lamb away from their mothers. This is the time you have to go to the{market}with wethers and substandard ewe lambs.
